author: pburba
msg: Follow-up to r34091.  Make reintegrate even more tolerant of subtree
Subtrees with mergeinfo in the source are ok as long as their explicit *and*
implicit mergeinfo show that the reintegrate target has been uniformly
This change also improves the error message that reintegrate produces
when the source hasn't had the target uniformly merged to it.  Instead of
showing what has been merged to what subtree, and leaving it up to the user
to calculate what needs to be merged, it skips right to showing what needs
to be merged for the reintegrate to work.
source's mergeinfo so it only represents what comes from the target,
instead create a catalog that describes what hasn't been merged from the
but rather return a catalog that describes what hasn't been previously
merged from the reintegrate target to the source.  Move some error handling
back to the caller, i.e. svn_client_merge_reintegrate which has the context
to produce a better error message.
and ensure_all_missing_ranges_are_phantoms().  If applicable create the
detailed error message here describing what isn't merged into the source
(reintegrate_with_subtree_mergeinfo): Tweak expected error text to show
what *needs* to be merged rather than what was merged and remove

author: julianfoad
msg: Improve a server error message "Target path does not exist" by reporting what
(drive): Include the target path in the "Target path does not exist" error.

author: stsp
msg: Fix an API quirk which was a relic from the times when 'svn info'
had to be run on the parent directory of a tree conflict victim.
... this, and return a single conflict description
instead of appending one to an existing string.
... this, and adjust docstring to reflect new semantics

author: stsp
msg: Remove elaborate descriptions of tree conflicts in favour of
Print short one-line tree conflict descriptions instead
of the old long multi-line descriptions.
(print_info): Print "Tree conflict:" info on a single line.
